author: James Xu
description: Lithuania and the Philippines move toward closer military cooperation against Beijing’s aggression in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines, Lithuania Deepen Defense Ties Amid China Tensions

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis The Trump administration has had a significant global impact, particularly in disrupting the status quo in international trade. But its northern neighbour—with whom the United States shares deep economic and historical ties—has experienced transformative changes on multiple fronts as a result of Trump’s presidency, including shifts in domestic policy. It is something Prime […]
title: How Trump’s Moves Have Reshaped Canada’s Path

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Canadian Armed Forces is giving itself an additional seven years to meet its equipment readiness requirements for the army and navy, as well as pushing back the dates for when it will meet its personnel readiness targets. The Department of National Defence said in its Departmental Plan for 2025-26 that it now plans to […]
title: Defence Department Pushes Back Equipment Readiness Objectives by 7 Years

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Sandstorm in Afghanistan, Military Exercise in Indonesia, and Invasion of Lovebugs

author: Olivia Gomm
description: An Ontario health agency has begun to inform patients of a data breach that Liberal MPP Adil Shamji says occurred in March and has affected at least 200,000 patients. Ontario Health atHome published a public notice saying it was advised by one of its vendors, Ontario Medical Supply (OMS) of a system outage. Upon investigation, […]
title: Ontario Health Agency Begins to Inform Patients of Data Breach That Happened in March

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario is investing $125 million to support the completion of up to 20,000 orthopedic procedures at private clinics during the next two years in a bid to reduce surgery wait times. Health Minister Sylvia Jones says the expansion will decrease wait times for hip and knee replacements, ensuring that 90 percent of patients in Ontario […]
title: Ontario to Increase Access to Hip and Knee Surgeries Through Private Clinics

author: Andrew Moran
description: Vietnam is 'just a pathway for China to us,' said Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick.
title: US Keeps Pressure on Chinese Goods Amid Vietnam Trade Deal

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of an organization representing automakers said he’s “cautiously optimistic” after meeting with Prime Minister Mark Carney to urge him to repeal the electric vehicle sales mandate. Canadian Vehicle Manufacturers’ Association CEO Brian Kingston joined the CEOs of Ford Canada, Stellantis Canada and GM Canada in a meeting with the prime minister Wednesday in […]
title: Automakers ‘Cautiously Optimistic’ on EV Mandate Changes After Meeting With Carney

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with Allen Zeng, journalist, commentator, and presenter of podcasts Fang Wei Time and Good Morning China. Zeng says the writing is on the wall for Chinese regime leader Xi Jinping, and that those who understand the mechanisms of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) can see that he is being replaced. […]
title: Xi Jinping No Longer Rules China, He’s Just a Figurehead: Allen Zeng

author: Josh Spasaro
description: Rural Victorians are facing pressure on multiple fronts over access to the precious resource.
title: Farmers Raise Alarm as Governments Divert Water Supply for Environment and Indigenous Use

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canadians living in Atlantic Canada face the highest personal income tax rates in the country for $50,000 of income, a new study finds. Atlantic Canada is facing “significant tax competitiveness challenges,” which can be harmful to productivity and economic growth by making the region “less attractive” to skilled workers and business investment, according to a […]
title: Atlantic Provinces Have Highest Personal Income Tax Rates in Canada for $50,000 Income: Study

author: The Canadian Press
description: Mounties say a wildfire that has triggered evacuations near Lytton, B.C. was caused when a wheel fell off an RCMP trailer in a “tremendously unfortunate” incident. Staff Sgt. Kris Clark says in a statement that the “equipment failure” that ignited the Izman Creek fire, about 250 kilometres northeast of Vancouver, happened on Tuesday afternoon on […]
title: Wheel Fell Off RCMP Trailer, Igniting Lytton, BC, Fire That Triggered Evacuations

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canadians have been cutting back on spending due to “escalating” trade tensions with the United States and the uncertainty surrounding American tariffs, a new report from TD Economics suggests. “The latest TD debit and credit card spending data suggest that Canadian consumers hit pause in the second quarter of 2025, reacting to escalating trade tensions,” […]
title: Canadians Cutting Back on Spending Amid Trade Tensions With US: TD Report

author: Chandra Philip
description: An inter-provincial organization is launching a campaign to promote Christian candidates in the upcoming Alberta municipal elections, saying it wants to engage and bring together voters and candidates with similar values. The event, put on by the Christian Impact Network (CIN), will start in Westlock on July 5, as a way for voters to get […]
title: Christian Group Plans Rallies in Alberta to Promote Municipal Election Candidates

author: Sophia Lam
description: 'While it’s mandatory for first-year high school students, the brainwashing goes far beyond the classroom,' said one teacher.
title: Former Chinese Teachers Explain How the CCP Has Politicised Education for Control

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Montreal mother who allegedly abandoned her daughter in a field in Ontario last month has been charged with criminal negligence causing bodily harm. The 34-year-old woman appeared in court this morning as part of her bail hearing at the courthouse in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Que., west of Montreal. She has already been charged with unlawful abandonment […]
title: Mother Who Allegedly Abandoned Montreal Girl Charged With Criminal Negligence

author: Guy Birchall
description: The nation was plunged into turmoil in December after the president declared martial law, sparking his impeachment and a snap election.
title: South Korea Revises Martial Law Rules

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Automotive CEOs asked Prime Minister Mark Carney this week to repeal his government’s Electric Vehicle (EV) mandate that requires all vehicles sold in Canada to have zero-emissions by 2035. The CEOs of Ford Canada, Stellantis Canada, and GM Canada, as well as the Canadian Vehicle Manufacturers’ Association, met with Carney on July 2. Canadian Vehicle […]
title: Top Automaker CEOs Ask Carney to End EV Mandate

author: The Canadian Press
description: Statistics Canada says the country’s merchandise trade deficit narrowed to $5.9 billion in May as gold exports climbed higher. The result compares with the record trade deficit of $7.6 billion seen in April. Exports were up 1.1 percent in May at $60.8 billion as exports of metal and non-metallic mineral products increased 15.1 percent in […]
title: Statistics Canada Says Merchandise Trade Deficit $5.9 Billion in May

author: Yeny Sora Robles
description: 'My solidarity with all those affected and my recognition to the emergency services that are working to extinguish it,' Spain's prime minister said.
title: Two People Die in Fires in Spain, Amid Heatwave in Europe

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has announced the creation of a provincial police force and the identity of its newly appointed chief. Former deputy Calgary police chief Sat Parhar has been selected to head the newly established Alberta Sheriffs Police Service which will be based in Calgary, Smith announced at a July 2 press conference. Parhar […]
title: Alberta Appoints Former Calgary Officer as Chief of New Provincial Police Force

author: Carolina Avendano
description: CALGARY—On a main street in Alberta’s largest city, flags bearing the symbols of the Calgary Stampede go up each year in mid-May. They feature the renowned festival’s initials alongside silhouettes of cowboys, chuckwagon riders, and other classic Stampede figures, in white and set against a bold red background. Soon, those quiet markers will be joined […]
title: An Event Like No Other: Behind the Spirit of the Calgary Stampede

author: Frank Fang
description: Chinese companies' support for Russia’s war in Ukraine poses a 'serious threat' to European security, EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said.
title: EU Presses China Over Support for Russia’s War, Export Restrictions on Rare Earths

author: Owen Evans
description: 'These carbon credits will have to be verifiable, certifiable and additional,' said EU Climate Commissioner Wopke Hoekstra.
title: EU Opens Door to International Carbon Credits in Net Zero Plan

author: The Canadian Press
description: Confidence federal public servants have in their senior managers has fallen in recent years, a new survey suggests. The 2024 Public Service Employee Survey said 55 percent of public servants have confidence in senior management at their department or agency, down from 64 percent in 2022 and 68 percent in 2020. Almost two-thirds of respondents […]
title: Fewer Federal Bureaucrats Express Confidence in Their Bosses, Survey Suggests

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec’s language watchdog has changed its tune on whether it’s acceptable to use the word “go” to cheer on sports teams. In a new guideline posted in its online dictionary, the Office québécois de la langue française says that while “allez” is the preferred term, it’s now “partially legitimized” to use the English word to […]
title: Quebec Language Watchdog Now Says It’s OK to Use ‘Go’ to Support Sports Teams

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The former health secretary appeared before the UK Covid-19 Inquiry and was quizzed on the high number of excess deaths in care homes during the lockdown era.
title: Hancock Denies ‘Cull of Elderly’ in Moving COVID-19 Patients from Hospitals to Care Homes

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Travellers are being warned flights may be delayed at airports across the country today after NAV Canada received bomb threats targeting its facilities in several cities. Canada’s air navigation service provider said threats were received at facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Calgary, and Vancouver early this morning and air traffic control towers at all […]
title: Nationwide Flights Disrupted by Bomb Threats, Canada’s Air Navigation Agency Says

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The government said the reforms will 'future-proof' the NHS, but critics warned it overlooks funding and staffing crises.

description: The Pentagon announced on July 2 that it was pausing some shipments of weapons to the country as it conducted a capability review.

description: Gale-force winds in the area, with gusts reaching about 50 miles per hour, are making firefighting work very difficult.

author: Reuters
description: TOKYO/HONG KONG—Viral rumours of impending disaster stemming from a comic book prediction have taken the sheen off Japan’s tourism boom, with some airlines cancelling flights from Hong Kong where passengers numbers have plunged. Japan has seen record numbers of visitors this year, with April setting an all-time monthly high of 3.9 million travelers. That dipped […]
title: Manga Doomsday Prediction Spooks Tourists to Japan

description: The Portuguese Football Federation confirmed the news on Thursday morning.
title: Liverpool Soccer Star Diogo Jota Dies in Car Crash in Spain

description: Thirty-five people have been rescued so far, the East Java rescue agency said, with the rest still missing.

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Calgary Stampede kicks off this week, launching 10 days of rodeo competitions, historical exhibits, farming showcases, and a wide range of family-friendly activities. The 113th Calgary Stampede will begin on July 4 with its iconic parade, featuring over 110 entries along a five-kilometre route through downtown. The lineup will include 35 floats, nine marching […]
title: ‘Horsepower, Heritage, and Family-Friendly Fun’: Key Events at This Year’s Calgary Stampede

author: Andrew Thornebrooke
description: 'Certainly all of the intelligence that we’ve seen suggests … those facilities were completely obliterated,' Defense Department spokesperson Sean Parnell said.
